awd_abstract_narration:
This award is made as part of the FY 2019 Mathematical Sciences Postdoctoral Research Fellowships Program. Each of the fellowships supports a research and training project at a host institution in the mathematical sciences, including applications to other disciplines, under the mentorship of a sponsoring scientist. The title of the project for this fellowship to Felix Gotti is "Rings defined by factorization properties".  The host institution for the fellowship is University of Florida, Gainesville and the sponsoring scientist is Peter Sin.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
As part of this research project, the PI investigated the algebraic and factorization structure of certain families of commutative torsion-free monoids and their corresponding monoid algebras (related algebraic and combinatorics structure were also studied, although less systematically).
As a result, the theory of commutative semigroup/monoid algebras was developed in the direction of the classical book "commutative semigroup ring" by Robert Gilmer. The same theory was developed by Gilmer under the following methodology: given an algebraic or arithmetic property P, find reasonable conditions/hypotheses on a pair $(M,R)$ ($M$ being a commutative monoid and $R$ being a commutative ring) so that if both $M$ and $R$ satisfy property P, then the monoid algebra $R[M]$ of $M$ over $R$ also satisfy property P. The PI further developed the theory of commutative monoid algebra following the described methodology.
The development of this research project (and smaller related projects in the context of integral domains) can be found in several papers the PI has published during the past 3 years.


1. Hereditary atomicity in integral domains (with J. Coykendall and R. Hasenauer), Journal of Pure and Applied Algebra, Vol. \textbf{227} (2023) 107249.


2. On the subatomicity of polynomial semidomains (with H. Polo). In: Algebraic, Number Theoretic, and Topological Aspects of Ring Theory (Eds. J. L. Chabert, M. Fontana, S. Frisch, S. Glaz, and K. Johnson) pp. 197--212, Springer International Publishing, Switzerland, 2023.


3. On the additive structure of algebraic valuations of polynomial semirings (with J. Correa-Morris), Journal of Pure and Applied Algebra, Vol. \textbf{226} (2022) 107104.


4. On semigroup algebras with rational exponents, Communications in Algebra, Vol. \textbf{50} (2022) 3--18.


5. Divisibility in rings of integer-valued polynomials (with B. Li) New York Journal of Mathematics, Vol. \textbf{28} (2022) 117--139.


6. Bounded and finite factorization domains (with D. F. Anderson). In: Rings, Monoids, and Module Theory (Eds. A. Badawi and J. Coykendall) pp. 7--57, Springer Proceedings in Mathematics \& Statistics, vol. \textbf{382}, Singapore, 2022.


7. Length-factoriality in commutative monoids and integral domains (with S. T. Chapman, J. Coykendall, and W. W. Smith) Journal of Algebra, Vol. \textbf{578} (2021) 186--212.


8. Bi-atomic classes of positive semirings (with N. R. Baeth and S. T. Chapman) Semigroup Forum, Vol. \textbf{103} (2021) 1--23.


9. On strongly primary monoids, with a focus on Puiseux monoids (with A. Geroldinger and S. Tringali) Journal of Algebra, Vol. \textbf{567} (2021) 310--345.


10. When is a Puiseux monoid atomic? (with S. T. Chapman and M.~Gotti) The American Mathematical Monthly, Vol. \textbf{128} (2021) 302--321.
11. Geometric and combinatorial aspects of submonoids of a finite-rank free commutative monoid, Linear Algebra and Its Applications, Vol. \textbf{604} (2020) 146--186.


12. Factorization in upper triangular matrices over information semialgebras (with N. R. Baeth) Journal of Algebra, Vol. \textbf{562} (2020) 466--496.


13. The system of sets of lengths and the elasticity of submonoids of a finite-rank free commutative monoid, Journal of Algebra and its Applications, Vol. \textbf{19} (2020) 2050137.


14. Irreducibility and factorizations in monoid rings. In: Numerical Semigroups (Eds. V. Barucci, S. T. Chapman, M. D'Anna, and R. Fr\"oberg) pp. 129--139, Springer INdAM Series, vol. \textbf{40}, Switzerland, 2020.
